ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: During the past four weeks: It has been easy to relate to others.
Notes: 0= Never/Not At All; 1= Occasionally; 2= About Half the Time; 3= Most of the Time; 4= Almost Always

ElementDescription: During the past four weeks: I felt isolated from other people.
Notes: 0= Almost Always; 1= Most of the Time; 2= About Half the Time; 3= Occasionally; 4= Never/Not At All

ElementDescription: During the past four weeks: I had someone to share my feelings with.
Notes: 0= Never/Not At All; 1= Occasionally; 2= About Half the Time; 3= Most of the Time; 4= Almost Always

ElementDescription: During the past four weeks: I found it easy to get in touch with others when I needed to.
Notes: 0= Never/Not At All; 1= Occasionally; 2= About Half the Time; 3= Most of the Time; 4= Almost Always

ElementDescription: During the past four weeks: When with other people, I felt separate from them.
Notes: 0= Almost Always; 1= Most of the Time; 2= About Half the Time; 3= Occasionally; 4= Never/Not At All

ElementDescription: During the past four weeks: I felt alone and friendless.
Notes: 0= Almost Always; 1= Most of the Time; 2= About Half the Time; 3= Occasionally; 4= Never/Not At All
Total sum of 6 items, friends_1 to friend_6
